summary: Federal regulations are legally binding, while guidance documents typically are not. Nonetheless, guidance can show an agency's interpretation of regulations and drive its actions. This testimony shares findings from 2 reports, including: Selected agencies generally followed guidance development standards but could improve their processes and how they disseminate guidance online Agencies were less likely to comply with the Congressional Review Act for regulations promulgated during...
title: Federal Regulations: Opportunities to Improve the Effectiveness and Transparency of Regulatory and Guidance Practices
